body.p:
Louisville Kentucky
March 9th 1864
To
Hon. T. E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Frankfort Ky
Sir
I saw paragraph in our City paper stating that you had offered to Genl. Boyle the appointment of Kentucky Claim Agent at Washington D. C.
I saw another paragraph on yesterday stating that Genl Boyle had declined accepting it.

I write to say to you that if you have not made an appointment yet and are not committed to any one and will so inform me I would like to be further informed as to details of the duties etc etc of the office with view of performing its duties if you should appoint me.
I have been engaged in Govt Claim business for several years and can satisfy you as to qualifications, etc.

I have known Mr Barkley, as an industrious and laborious man, devoted to his business as agt
for collection of claims against the Government. He is one of the few men I know in whose christianity I have confidence. He stands at the head of his profession as a Lawyer &c. If the place is not filled, I am confident his appointment will never be regretted by you, while it will be blest by those whose intrest are committed to his care.

Respectfully
J M Hewett
2d Ky Battery
